name: Marcus Aurelius
what_did:
Marcus Aurelius was a powerful Roman emperor who ruled with wisdom.
He wrote a book called 'Meditations' full of calm thoughts and advice.
He followed Stoicism — the idea that we should stay calm and do our duty.
why_matters:
Marcus showed that a leader could also be wise and thoughtful.
His book still teaches people how to stay strong in hard times.
He’s remembered as a 'philosopher king'.

questions.q: What did Marcus believe people should do?
options: Stay calm and do their duty

questions.q: What was Marcus Aurelius’s way of thinking called?

fun_fact: He wrote 'Meditations' as private notes — he didn’t plan to publish them!
